articles.description: ALZHEIMER'S disease is the most common cause of dementia, accounting for about two-thirds of cases in older people. The goal of ongoing research is to pinpoint the causes of Alzheimer's in a bid to forestall it. A new study advances this effort, detecting a h…
articles.content:
The immuno-infrared sensor was able to identify the 68 test subjects who later developed Alzheimer's disease with a high degree of test accuracy.
